definition: at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
to remove/to withdraw
rut/track/rhyme/(dialect) way/method

sentences.english: I will not be stubborn, still can deal with time.
sentences.chinese: 不会再固执的我，依旧对时间没辙。

sentences.english: I know he has a weakness for sweets.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他看到甜食就没辙。

sentences.english: Crying is the baby's forte. Whenever she cries, her mother doesn't know how to deal with her.
sentences.chinese: 哭可是宝宝的拿手戏，只要她一哭，妈妈没辙了。

sentences.english: When the girls tease him,he doesn't quite know how to act up.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘们拿他逗乐时，他就没辙了。

sentences.english: If you absolutely had to, you could use a chain saw in a string quartet.
sentences.chinese: 实在没辙，您拿锯子也可以参加弦乐四重奏。

sentences.english: Obviously, plastic surgery is no option for this hag!
sentences.chinese: 显然，整容手术也拿这个巫婆没辙。

sentences.english: Well, you're basically out of luck.

definition: unmoved by force or persuasion
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to admit defeat
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
not wishing to acknowledge sb/unwilling to respond
variant of 不答理[bu4 da1 li3]
thus/in this way/like this
lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1

definition: can't afford to offend/dare not provoke/difficult to deal with/insufferable
unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
can't persuade/unable to make (sb) change their mind/unable to resist (sb)
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
to use force
unbearable/terrible/enough/unlikely
